intro: Diteilis layardii, commonly known as the Layard's dandelion, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its yellow composite flowers and toothed leaves. The plant typically grows in grasslands and open areas, thriving in well-drained soils. It produces a capsule fruit that contains numerous small seeds, which are dispersed by the wind. Diteilis layardii is often found in arid and semi-arid regions, showing adaptation to dry environments.
